item.title: Setup your own DNS server with ease
item.author: Author
item.description: You may not be aware of it, but every time you type a URL in the address bar of your browser, it is transmitted in clear text to the DNS server you are using. A bit of background The latter then takes care of resolving the domain name, and tells your machine how to connect to the right server that will distribute the expected data. But here’s the problem : DNS is a 40 years old protocol, and at that time engineers were not too sensitive to privacy issues.
